icon.description: The icon to display with the message.  Defaults to warning.

roles.description: (Deprecated) The roles to send the notification to.  If roles is not passed it defaults to all roles

role_ids.description: The roles to send the notification to.  If roles is not passed it defaults to all roles

id.description: The unique identifier for the account role/user assignment.

role.description: The account role assigned. This can be 'AccountAdmin' or a user-defined role created by the Roles API.

user.description: The user the role is assigned to. See the Users API for details.

workflow_state.description: The status of the account role/user assignment.

AnonymousUserDisplay.description: This mini-object is returned in place of UserDisplay when returning student data for anonymous assignments, and includes an anonymous ID to identify a user within the scope of a single assignment.

anonymous_id.description: A unique short ID identifying this user within the scope of a particular assignment.

avatar_image_url.description: A URL to retrieve a generic avatar.

display_name.description: The anonymized display name for the student.

id.description: The unique identifier for the answer.  Do not supply if this answer is part of a new question

answer_weight.description: An integer to determine correctness of the answer. Incorrect answers should be 0, correct answers should be 100.

answer_comments.description: Specific contextual comments for a particular answer.
answer_comments.example: Remember to check your spelling prior to submitting this answer.

text_after_answers.description: Used in missing word questions.  The text to follow the missing word

answer_match_left.description: Used in matching questions.  The static value of the answer that will be displayed on the left for students to match for.

answer_match_right.description: Used in matching questions. The correct match for the value given in answer_match_left.  Will be displayed in a dropdown with the other answer_match_right values..

matching_answer_incorrect_matches.description:
Used in matching questions. A list of distractors, delimited by new lines (
) that will be seeded with all the answer_match_right values.

numerical_answer_type.description: Used in numerical questions.  Values can be 'exact_answer', 'range_answer', or 'precision_answer'.

exact.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'exact_answer'.  The value the answer should equal.

margin.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'exact_answer'. The margin of error allowed for the student's answer.

approximate.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'precision_answer'.  The value the answer should equal.

precision.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'precision_answer'. The numerical precision that will be used when comparing the student's answer.

start.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'range_answer'. The start of the allowed range (inclusive).

end.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'range_answer'. The end of the allowed range (inclusive).

blank_id.description: Used in fill in multiple blank and multiple dropdowns questions.

Appointment.description: Date and time for an appointment

id.description: The appointment identifier.
The ID of the appointment group

title.description: The title of the appointment group

start_at.description: The start of the first time slot in the appointment group

end_at.description: The end of the last time slot in the appointment group

description.description: The text description of the appointment group

location_name.description: The location name of the appointment group

location_address.description: The address of the appointment group's location

participant_count.description: The number of participant who have reserved slots (see include[] argument)

reserved_times.description: The start and end times of slots reserved by the current user as well as the id of the calendar event for the reservation (see include[] argument)

context_codes.description: The context codes (i.e. courses) this appointment group belongs to. Only people in these courses will be eligible to sign up.

sub_context_codes.description: The sub-context codes (i.e. course sections and group categories) this appointment group is restricted to

workflow_state.description: Current state of the appointment group ('pending', 'active' or 'deleted'). 'pending' indicates that it has not been published yet and is invisible to participants.

requiring_action.description: Boolean indicating whether the current user needs to sign up for this appointment group (i.e. it's reservable and the min_appointments_per_participant limit has not been met by this user).

appointments_count.description: Number of time slots in this appointment group

appointments.description: Calendar Events representing the time slots (see include[] argument) Refer to the Calendar Events API for more information

new_appointments.description: Newly created time slots (same format as appointments above). Only returned in Create/Update responses where new time slots have been added

max_appointments_per_participant.description: Maximum number of time slots a user may register for, or null if no limit

min_appointments_per_participant.description: Minimum number of time slots a user must register for. If not set, users do not need to sign up for any time slots

participants_per_appointment.description: Maximum number of participants that may register for each time slot, or null if no limit

participant_visibility.description: 'private' means participants cannot see who has signed up for a particular time slot, 'protected' means that they can

participant_type.description: Indicates how participants sign up for the appointment group, either as individuals ('User') or in student groups ('Group'). Related to sub_context_codes (i.e. 'Group' signups always have a single group category)

url.description: URL for this appointment group (to update, delete, etc.)

html_url.description: URL for a user to view this appointment group

created_at.description: When the appointment group was created

updated_at.description: When the appointment group was last updated

Assessment.description: A simple assessment that collects pass/fail results for a student

id.description: A unique identifier for this live assessment

key.description: A client specified unique identifier for the assessment

title.description: A human readable title for the assessment

id.description: the ID of the assignment

name.description: the name of the assignment

description.description: the assignment description, in an HTML fragment

created_at.description: The time at which this assignment was originally created

updated_at.description: The time at which this assignment was last modified in any way

due_at.description: the due date for the assignment. returns null if not present. NOTE: If this assignment has assignment overrides, this field will be the due date as it applies to the user requesting information from the API.

lock_at.description: the lock date (assignment is locked after this date). returns null if not present. NOTE: If this assignment has assignment overrides, this field will be the lock date as it applies to the user requesting information from the API.

unlock_at.description: the unlock date (assignment is unlocked after this date) returns null if not present NOTE: If this assignment has assignment overrides, this field will be the unlock date as it applies to the user requesting information from the API.

all_dates.description: (Optional) all dates associated with the assignment, if applicable

course_id.description: the ID of the course the assignment belongs to

html_url.description: the URL to the assignment's web page

submissions_download_url.description: the URL to download all submissions as a zip

assignment_group_id.description: the ID of the assignment's group

due_date_required.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the assignment requires a due date based on the account level setting

allowed_extensions.description: Allowed file extensions, which take effect if submission_types includes 'online_upload'.

max_name_length.description: An integer indicating the maximum length an assignment's name may be

turnitin_enabled.description: Boolean flag indicating whether or not Turnitin has been enabled for the assignment. NOTE: This flag will not appear unless your account has the Turnitin plugin available

vericite_enabled.description: Boolean flag indicating whether or not VeriCite has been enabled for the assignment. NOTE: This flag will not appear unless your account has the VeriCite plugin available

turnitin_settings.description: Settings to pass along to turnitin to control what kinds of matches should be considered. originality_report_visibility can be 'immediate', 'after_grading', 'after_due_date', or 'never' exclude_small_matches_type can be null, 'percent', 'words' exclude_small_matches_value: - if type is null, this will be null also - if type is 'percent', this will be a number between 0 and 100 representing match size to exclude as a percentage of the document size. - if type is 'words', this will be number > 0 representing how many words a match must contain for it to be considered NOTE: This flag will not appear unless your account has the Turnitin plugin available

grade_group_students_individually.description: If this is a group assignment, boolean flag indicating whether or not students will be graded individually.

external_tool_tag_attributes.description: (Optional) assignment's settings for external tools if submission_types include 'external_tool'. Only url and new_tab are included (new_tab defaults to false).  Use the 'External Tools' API if you need more information about an external tool.

peer_reviews.description: Boolean indicating if peer reviews are required for this assignment

automatic_peer_reviews.description: Boolean indicating peer reviews are assigned automatically. If false, the teacher is expected to manually assign peer reviews.

peer_review_count.description: Integer representing the amount of reviews each user is assigned. NOTE: This key is NOT present unless you have automatic_peer_reviews set to true.

peer_reviews_assign_at.description: String representing a date the reviews are due by. Must be a date that occurs after the default due date. If blank, or date is not after the assignment's due date, the assignment's due date will be used. NOTE: This key is NOT present unless you have automatic_peer_reviews set to true.

intra_group_peer_reviews.description: Boolean representing whether or not members from within the same group on a group assignment can be assigned to peer review their own group's work

group_category_id.description: The ID of the assignments group set, if this is a group assignment. For group discussions, set group_category_id on the discussion topic, not the linked assignment.

needs_grading_count.description: if the requesting user has grading rights, the number of submissions that need grading.

needs_grading_count_by_section.description: if the requesting user has grading rights and the 'needs_grading_count_by_section' flag is specified, the number of submissions that need grading split out by section. NOTE: This key is NOT present unless you pass the 'needs_grading_count_by_section' argument as true.  ANOTHER NOTE: it's possible to be enrolled in multiple sections, and if a student is setup that way they will show an assignment that needs grading in multiple sections (effectively the count will be duplicated between sections)

position.description: the sorting order of the assignment in the group

post_to_sis.description: (optional, present if Sync Grades to SIS feature is enabled)

integration_id.description: (optional, Third Party unique identifier for Assignment)

integration_data.description: (optional, Third Party integration data for assignment)

points_possible.description: the maximum points possible for the assignment

submission_types.description: the types of submissions allowed for this assignment list containing one or more of the following: 'discussion_topic', 'online_quiz', 'on_paper', 'none', 'external_tool', 'online_text_entry', 'online_url', 'online_upload', 'media_recording', 'student_annotation'

has_submitted_submissions.description: If true, the assignment has been submitted to by at least one student

grading_type.description: The type of grading the assignment receives; one of 'pass_fail', 'percent', 'letter_grade', 'gpa_scale', 'points'

grading_standard_id.description: The id of the grading standard being applied to this assignment. Valid if grading_type is 'letter_grade' or 'gpa_scale'.

unpublishable.description: Whether the assignment's 'published' state can be changed to false. Will be false if there are student submissions for the assignment.

only_visible_to_overrides.description: Whether the assignment is only visible to overrides.

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

lock_info.description: (Optional) Information for the user about the lock. Present when locked_for_user is true.

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This assignment is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

quiz_id.description: (Optional) id of the associated quiz (applies only when submission_types is ['online_quiz'])

anonymous_submissions.description: (Optional) whether anonymous submissions are accepted (applies only to quiz assignments)

discussion_topic.description: (Optional) the DiscussionTopic associated with the assignment, if applicable

freeze_on_copy.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating if assignment will be frozen when it is copied. NOTE: This field will only be present if the AssignmentFreezer plugin is available for your account.

frozen.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating if assignment is frozen for the calling user. NOTE: This field will only be present if the AssignmentFreezer plugin is available for your account.

frozen_attributes.description: (Optional) Array of frozen attributes for the assignment. Only account administrators currently have permission to change an attribute in this list. Will be empty if no attributes are frozen for this assignment. Possible frozen attributes are: title, description, lock_at, points_possible, grading_type, submission_types, assignment_group_id, allowed_extensions, group_category_id, notify_of_update, peer_reviews NOTE: This field will only be present if the AssignmentFreezer plugin is available for your account.

submission.description: (Optional) If 'submission' is included in the 'include' parameter, includes a Submission object that represents the current user's (user who is requesting information from the api) current submission for the assignment. See the Submissions API for an example response. If the user does not have a submission, this key will be absent.

use_rubric_for_grading.description: (Optional) If true, the rubric is directly tied to grading the assignment. Otherwise, it is only advisory. Included if there is an associated rubric.

rubric_settings.description: (Optional) An object describing the basic attributes of the rubric, including the point total. Included if there is an associated rubric.

rubric.description: (Optional) A list of scoring criteria and ratings for each rubric criterion. Included if there is an associated rubric.

assignment_visibility.description: (Optional) If 'assignment_visibility' is included in the 'include' parameter, includes an array of student IDs who can see this assignment.

overrides.description: (Optional) If 'overrides' is included in the 'include' parameter, includes an array of assignment override objects.

omit_from_final_grade.description: (Optional) If true, the assignment will be omitted from the student's final grade

moderated_grading.description: Boolean indicating if the assignment is moderated.

grader_count.description: The maximum number of provisional graders who may issue grades for this assignment. Only relevant for moderated assignments. Must be a positive value, and must be set to 1 if the course has fewer than two active instructors. Otherwise, the maximum value is the number of active instructors in the course minus one, or 10 if the course has more than 11 active instructors.

final_grader_id.description: The user ID of the grader responsible for choosing final grades for this assignment. Only relevant for moderated assignments.

grader_comments_visible_to_graders.description: Boolean indicating if provisional graders' comments are visible to other provisional graders. Only relevant for moderated assignments.

graders_anonymous_to_graders.description: Boolean indicating if provisional graders' identities are hidden from other provisional graders. Only relevant for moderated assignments with grader_comments_visible_to_graders set to true.

grader_names_visible_to_final_grader.description: Boolean indicating if provisional grader identities are visible to the final grader. Only relevant for moderated assignments.

anonymous_grading.description: Boolean indicating if the assignment is graded anonymously. If true, graders cannot see student identities.

allowed_attempts.description: The number of submission attempts a student can make for this assignment. -1 is considered unlimited.

post_manually.description: Whether the assignment has manual posting enabled. Only relevant for courses using New Gradebook.

score_statistics.description: (Optional) If 'score_statistics' and 'submission' are included in the 'include' parameter and statistics are available, includes the min, max, and mode for this assignment

can_submit.description: (Optional) If retrieving a single assignment and 'can_submit' is included in the 'include' parameter, flags whether user has the right to submit the assignment (i.e. checks enrollment dates, submission types, locked status, attempts remaining, etc...). Including 'can submit' automatically includes 'submission' in the include parameter. Not available when observed_users are included.

annotatable_attachment_id.description: The id of the attachment to be annotated by students. Relevant only if submission_types includes 'student_annotation'.

anonymize_students.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating whether student names are anonymized

require_lockdown_browser.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating whether the Respondus LockDown Browser is required for this assignment.

important_dates.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating whether this assignment has important dates.

muted.description: (Optional, Deprecated) Boolean indicating whether notifications are muted for this assignment.

AssignmentDate.description: Object representing a due date for an assignment or quiz. If the due date came from an assignment override, it will have an 'id' field.

id.description: (Optional, missing if 'base' is present) id of the assignment override this date represents

base.description: (Optional, present if 'id' is missing) whether this date represents the assignment's or quiz's default due date

due_at.description: The due date for the assignment. Must be between the unlock date and the lock date if there are lock dates

unlock_at.description: The unlock date for the assignment. Must be before the due date if there is a due date.

lock_at.description: The lock date for the assignment. Must be after the due date if there is a due date.

id.description: A synthetic ID for the assignment

start_at.description: The due_at timestamp of the assignment

end_at.description: The due_at timestamp of the assignment

description.description: The HTML description of the assignment

context_code.description: the context code of the (course) calendar this assignment belongs to

workflow_state.description: Current state of the assignment ('published' or 'deleted')

url.description: URL for this assignment (note that updating/deleting should be done via the Assignments API)

html_url.description: URL for a user to view this assignment

all_day_date.description: The due date of this assignment

all_day.description: Boolean indicating whether this is an all-day event (e.g. assignment due at midnight)

created_at.description: When the assignment was created

updated_at.description: When the assignment was last updated

assignment.description: The full assignment JSON data (See the Assignments API)

assignment_overrides.description: The list of AssignmentOverrides that apply to this event (See the Assignments API). This information is useful for determining which students or sections this assignment-due event applies to.

important_dates.description: Boolean indicating whether this has important dates.

assignment_id.description: The ID of the Assignment the extension belongs to.

user_id.description: The ID of the Student that needs the assignment extension.

extra_attempts.description: Number of times the student is allowed to re-submit the assignment

id.description: the id of the Assignment Group

name.description: the name of the Assignment Group

position.description: the position of the Assignment Group

group_weight.description: the weight of the Assignment Group

sis_source_id.description: the sis source id of the Assignment Group

integration_data.description: the integration data of the Assignment Group

assignments.description: the assignments in this Assignment Group (see the Assignment API for a detailed list of fields)

rules.description: the grading rules that this Assignment Group has

AssignmentGroupAttributes.description: Some of the attributes of an Assignment Group. See Assignments API for more details

id.description: the id of the Assignment Group

name.description: the name of the Assignment Group

group_weight.description: the weight of the Assignment Group

sis_source_id.description: the sis source id of the Assignment Group

integration_data.description: the integration data of the Assignment Group

id.description: the ID of the assignment override

assignment_id.description: the ID of the assignment the override applies to

student_ids.description: the IDs of the override's target students (present if the override targets an ad-hoc set of students)

group_id.description: the ID of the override's target group (present if the override targets a group and the assignment is a group assignment)

course_section_id.description: the ID of the overrides's target section (present if the override targets a section)

due_at.description: the overridden due at (present if due_at is overridden)

all_day.description: the overridden all day flag (present if due_at is overridden)

all_day_date.description: the overridden all day date (present if due_at is overridden)

unlock_at.description: the overridden unlock at (present if unlock_at is overridden)

lock_at.description: the overridden lock at, if any (present if lock_at is overridden)

created_at.description: timestamp of the event

pseudonym_id.description: ID of the pseudonym (login) associated with the event

account_id.description: ID of the account associated with the event. will match the account_id in the associated pseudonym.

user_id.description: ID of the user associated with the event will match the user_id in the associated pseudonym.

id.description: Valid for all providers.

log_in_url.description: Valid for SAML and CAS providers.

auth_base.description: Valid for LDAP and CAS providers.

jit_provisioning.description: Just In Time provisioning. Valid for all providers except Canvas (which has the similar in concept self_registration setting).

mfa_required.description: If multi-factor authentication is required when logging in with this authentication provider. The account must not have MFA disabled.

type.description: ['gravatar'|'attachment'|'no_pic'] The type of avatar record, for categorization purposes.

url.description: The url of the avatar

token.description: A unique representation of the avatar record which can be used to set the avatar with the user update endpoint. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.

display_name.description: A textual description of the avatar record.

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

content-type.description: ['attachment' type only] the content-type of the attachment.

filename.description: ['attachment' type only] the filename of the attachment

size.description: ['attachment' type only] the size of the attachment

BlackoutDate.description: Blackout dates are used to prevent scheduling assignments on a given date in course pacing.

id.description: the ID of the blackout date

context_id.description: the context owning the blackout date

start_date.description: the start date of the blackout date

end_date.description: the end date of the blackout date

id.description: The ID of the migration.

template_id.description: The ID of the template the migration belongs to. Only present when querying a blueprint course.

subscription_id.description: The ID of the associated course's blueprint subscription. Only present when querying a course associated with a blueprint.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who queued the migration.

workflow_state.description: Current state of the content migration: queued, exporting, imports_queued, completed, exports_failed, imports_failed

created_at.description: Time when the migration was queued

imports_queued_at.description: Time when the exports were completed and imports were queued

imports_completed_at.description: Time when the imports were completed

comment.description: User-specified comment describing changes made in this operation
comment.example: Fixed spelling in question 3 of midterm exam

BlueprintRestriction.description: A set of restrictions on editing for copied objects in associated courses

content.description: Restriction on main content (e.g. title, description).

points.description: Restriction on points possible for assignments and graded learning objects

due_dates.description: Restriction on due dates for assignments and graded learning objects

availability_dates.description: Restriction on availability dates for an object

BlueprintSubscription.description: Associates a course with a blueprint

id.description: The ID of the blueprint course subscription

template_id.description: The ID of the blueprint template the associated course is subscribed to

id.description: The ID of the template.

course_id.description: The ID of the Course the template belongs to.

last_export_completed_at.description: Time when the last export was completed

associated_course_count.description: Number of associated courses for the template

id.description: The ID of the calendar event

title.description: The title of the calendar event

start_at.description: The start timestamp of the event

end_at.description: The end timestamp of the event

description.description: The HTML description of the event

location_name.description: The location name of the event

location_address.description: The address where the event is taking place

context_code.description: the context code of the calendar this event belongs to (course, user or group)

effective_context_code.description: if specified, it indicates which calendar this event should be displayed on. for example, a section-level event would have the course's context code here, while the section's context code would be returned above)

context_name.description: the context name of the calendar this event belongs to (course, user or group)

all_context_codes.description: a comma-separated list of all calendar contexts this event is part of

workflow_state.description: Current state of the event ('active', 'locked' or 'deleted') 'locked' indicates that start_at/end_at cannot be changed (though the event could be deleted). Normally only reservations or time slots with reservations are locked (see the Appointment Groups API)

hidden.description: Whether this event should be displayed on the calendar. Only true for course-level events with section-level child events.

parent_event_id.description: Normally null. If this is a reservation (see the Appointment Groups API), the id will indicate the time slot it is for. If this is a section-level event, this will be the course-level parent event.

child_events_count.description: The number of child_events. See child_events (and parent_event_id)

child_events.description: Included by default, but may be excluded (see include[] option). If this is a time slot (see the Appointment Groups API) this will be a list of any reservations. If this is a course-level event, this will be a list of section-level events (if any)

url.description: URL for this calendar event (to update, delete, etc.)

html_url.description: URL for a user to view this event

all_day.description: Boolean indicating whether this is an all-day event (midnight to midnight)

created_at.description: When the calendar event was created

updated_at.description: When the calendar event was last updated

appointment_group_id.description: Various Appointment-Group-related fields.These fields are only pertinent to time slots (appointments) and reservations of those time slots. See the Appointment Groups API. The id of the appointment group

appointment_group_url.description: The API URL of the appointment group

own_reservation.description: If the event is a reservation, this a boolean indicating whether it is the current user's reservation, or someone else's

reserve_url.description: If the event is a time slot, the API URL for reserving it

reserved.description: If the event is a time slot, a boolean indicating whether the user has already made a reservation for it

participant_type.description: The type of participant to sign up for a slot: 'User' or 'Group'

participants_per_appointment.description: If the event is a time slot, this is the participant limit

available_slots.description: If the event is a time slot and it has a participant limit, an integer indicating how many slots are available

user.description: If the event is a user-level reservation, this will contain the user participant JSON (refer to the Users API).

group.description: If the event is a group-level reservation, this will contain the group participant JSON (refer to the Groups API).

important_dates.description: Boolean indicating whether this has important dates.

series_uuid.description: Identifies the recurring event series this event may belong to

rrule.description: An iCalendar RRULE for defining how events in a recurring event series repeat.

series_natural_language.description: A natural language expression of how events occur in the series. (e.g. Daily, 2 times)

blackout_date.description: Boolean indicating whether this has blackout date.

ics.description: The URL of the calendar in ICS format

ChangeRecord.description: Describes a learning object change propagated to associated courses from a blueprint course

asset_id.description: The ID of the learning object that was changed in the blueprint course.

asset_type.description: The type of the learning object that was changed in the blueprint course.  One of 'assignment', 'attachment', 'discussion_topic', 'external_tool', 'quiz', 'wiki_page', 'syllabus', or 'settings'.  For 'syllabus' or 'settings', the asset_id is the course id.

asset_name.description: The name of the learning object that was changed in the blueprint course.

change_type.description: The type of change; one of 'created', 'updated', 'deleted'

html_url.description: The URL of the changed object

locked.description: Whether the object is locked in the blueprint

exceptions.description: A list of ExceptionRecords for linked courses that did not receive this update.

ColumnDatum.description: ColumnDatum objects contain the entry for a column for each user.

id.description: The unique identifier for the collaboration

collaboration_type.description: A name for the type of collaboration

document_id.description: The collaboration document identifier for the collaboration provider

user_id.description: The canvas id of the user who created the collaboration

context_id.description: The canvas id of the course or group to which the collaboration belongs

context_type.description: The canvas type of the course or group to which the collaboration belongs

url.description: The LTI launch url to view collaboration.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the collaboration was created

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the collaboration was last modified

type.description: Another representation of the collaboration type

update_url.description: The LTI launch url to edit the collaboration

user_name.description: The name of the user who owns the collaboration

id.description: The unique user or group identifier for the collaborator.

name.description: The name of the collaborator.

id.description: The ID of the CommMessage.

created_at.description: The date and time this message was created

sent_at.description: The date and time this message was sent

workflow_state.description: The workflow state of the message. One of 'created', 'staged', 'sending', 'sent', 'bounced', 'dashboard', 'cancelled', or 'closed'

from.description: The address that was put in the 'from' field of the message

from_name.description: The display name for the from address

to.description: The address the message was sent to:

reply_to.description: The reply_to header of the message

body.description: The plain text body of the message
body.example: This is the body of the message

html_body.description: The HTML body of the message.
html_body.example: <html><body>This is the body of the message</body></html>

id.description: The ID of the communication channel.

address.description: The address, or path, of the communication channel.

type.description: The type of communcation channel being described. Possible values are: 'email', 'push', 'sms', or 'twitter'. This field determines the type of value seen in 'address'.

position.description: The position of this communication channel relative to the user's other channels when they are ordered.

user_id.description: The ID of the user that owns this communication channel.

workflow_state.description: The current state of the communication channel. Possible values are: 'unconfirmed' or 'active'.

min_score.description: minimum score required to complete (only present when type == 'min_score')

completed.description: whether the calling user has met this requirement (Optional; present only if the caller is a student or if the optional parameter 'student_id' is included)

id.description: The id of the conference

conference_key.description: The 3rd party's ID for the conference

duration.description: The expected duration the conference is supposed to last

ended_at.description: The date that the conference ended at, null if it hasn't ended

started_at.description: The date the conference started at, null if it hasn't started

users.description: Array of user ids that are participants in the conference

has_advanced_settings.description: True if the conference type has advanced settings.

long_running.description: If true the conference is long running and has no expected end time

user_settings.description: A collection of settings specific to the conference type

recordings.description: A List of recordings for the conference

url.description: URL for the conference, may be null if the conference type doesn't set it

join_url.description: URL to join the conference, may be null if the conference type doesn't set it

context_type.description: The type of this conference's context, typically 'Course' or 'Group'.

context_id.description: The ID of this conference's context.

lock_explanation.example: This quiz is part of an unpublished module and is not available yet.

id.description: the unique identifier for the export

created_at.description: the date and time this export was requested

export_type.description: the type of content migration: 'common_cartridge' or 'qti'

attachment.description: attachment api object for the export package (not present before the export completes or after it becomes unavailable for download.)

progress_url.description: The api endpoint for polling the current progress

user_id.description: The ID of the user who started the export

workflow_state.description: Current state of the content migration: created exporting exported failed

id.description: The id of the content share for the current user

name.description: The name of the shared content

content_type.description: The type of content that was shared. Can be assignment, discussion_topic, page, quiz, module, or module_item.

created_at.description: The datetime the content was shared with this user.

updated_at.description: The datetime the content was updated.

user_id.description: The id of the user who sent or received the content share.

sender.description: The user who shared the content. This field is provided only to receivers; it is not populated in the sender's list of sent content shares.

receivers.description: An Array of users the content is shared with.  This field is provided only to senders; an empty array will be returned for the receiving users.

source_course.description: The course the content was originally shared from.

read_state.description: Whether the recipient has viewed the content share.

content_export.description: The content export record associated with this content share

id.description: the unique identifier for the conversation.

workflow_state.description: The current state of the conversation (read, unread or archived).

last_message.description: A <=100 character preview from the most recent message.

start_at.description: the date and time at which the last message was sent.

message_count.description: the number of messages in the conversation.

subscribed.description: whether the current user is subscribed to the conversation.

properties.description: Additional conversation flags (last_author, attachments, media_objects). Each listed property means the flag is set to true (i.e. the current user is the most recent author, there are attachments, or there are media objects)

audience.description: Array of user ids who are involved in the conversation, ordered by participation level, then alphabetical. Excludes current user, unless this is a monologue.

audience_contexts.description: Most relevant shared contexts (courses and groups) between current user and other participants. If there is only one participant, it will also include that user's enrollment(s)/ membership type(s) in each course/group.

avatar_url.description: URL to appropriate icon for this conversation (custom, individual or group avatar, depending on audience).

participants.description: Array of users participating in the conversation. Includes current user.

visible.description: indicates whether the conversation is visible under the current scope and filter. This attribute is always true in the index API response, and is primarily useful in create/update responses so that you can know if the record should be displayed in the UI. The default scope is assumed, unless a scope or filter is passed to the create/update API call.

context_name.description: Name of the course or group in which the conversation is occurring.

id.description: The user ID for the participant.

name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

full_name.description: The full name of the user.

avatar_url.description: If requested, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

id.description: the unique identifier for the course

sis_course_id.description: the SIS identifier for the course, if defined. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

integration_id.description: the integration identifier for the course, if defined. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: the unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

name.description: the full name of the course. If the requesting user has set a nickname for the course, the nickname will be shown here.

original_name.description: the actual course name. This field is returned only if the requesting user has set a nickname for the course.

workflow_state.description: the current state of the course one of 'unpublished', 'available', 'completed', or 'deleted'

account_id.description: the account associated with the course

root_account_id.description: the root account associated with the course

enrollment_term_id.description: the enrollment term associated with the course

grading_periods.description: A list of grading periods associated with the course

grading_standard_id.description: the grading standard associated with the course

grade_passback_setting.description: the grade_passback_setting set on the course

created_at.description: the date the course was created.

start_at.description: the start date for the course, if applicable

end_at.description: the end date for the course, if applicable

enrollments.description: A list of enrollments linking the current user to the course. for student enrollments, grading information may be included if include[]=total_scores

total_students.description: optional: the total number of active and invited students in the course

default_view.description: the type of page that users will see when they first visit the course - 'feed': Recent Activity Dashboard - 'wiki': Wiki Front Page - 'modules': Course Modules/Sections Page - 'assignments': Course Assignments List - 'syllabus': Course Syllabus Page other types may be added in the future

syllabus_body.description: optional: user-generated HTML for the course syllabus

needs_grading_count.description: optional: the number of submissions needing grading returned only if the current user has grading rights and include[]=needs_grading_count

term.description: optional: the enrollment term object for the course returned only if include[]=term

course_progress.description: optional: information on progress through the course returned only if include[]=course_progress

apply_assignment_group_weights.description: weight final grade based on assignment group percentages

permissions.description: optional: the permissions the user has for the course. returned only for a single course and include[]=permissions

public_description.description: optional: the public description of the course
public_description.example: Come one, come all to InstructureCon 2012!

access_restricted_by_date.description: optional: this will be true if this user is currently prevented from viewing the course because of date restriction settings

time_zone.description: The course's IANA time zone name.

blueprint.description: optional: whether the course is set as a Blueprint Course (blueprint fields require the Blueprint Courses feature)

blueprint_restrictions.description: optional: Set of restrictions applied to all locked course objects

blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type.description: optional: Sets of restrictions differentiated by object type applied to locked course objects

template.description: optional: whether the course is set as a template (requires the Course Templates feature)

CourseAttributes.description: Attributes of a course object.  See Courses API for more details

id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the origin course

name.description: The name of the origin course.

sis_id.description: The sis id of the origin_course.

integration_id.description: The integration ID of the origin_course.

id.description: the unique identifier for the course

name.description: the name for the course

id.description: ID of the event.

created_at.description: timestamp of the event

event_type.description: Course event type The event type defines the type and schema of the event_data object.

event_data.description: Course event data depending on the event type.  This will return an object containing the relevant event data.  An updated event type will return an UpdatedEventData object.

event_source.description: Course event source depending on the event type.  This will return a string containing the source of the event.

course.description: ID of the course for the event.

user.description: ID of the user for the event (who made the change).

page_view.description: ID of the page view during the event if it exists.

copied_from.description: ID of the course that this course was copied from. This is only included if the event_type is copied_from.

copied_to.description: ID of the course that this course was copied to. This is only included if the event_type is copied_to.

sis_batch.description: ID of the SIS batch that triggered the event.

name.description: the actual name of the course
name.example: S1048576 DPMS1200 Intro to Newtonian Mechanics

nickname.description: the calling user's nickname for the course

requirement_count.description: total number of requirements from all modules

requirement_completed_count.description: total number of requirements the user has completed from all modules

next_requirement_url.description: url to next module item that has an unmet requirement. null if the user has completed the course or the current module does not require sequential progress

completed_at.description: date the course was completed. null if the course has not been completed by this user

user_id.description: The ID of the Student that needs the quiz extension.

extra_attempts.description: Number of times the student is allowed to re-take the quiz over the multiple-attempt limit.

extra_time.description: Amount of extra time allowed for the quiz submission, in minutes.

manually_unlocked.description: The student can take the quiz even if it's locked for everyone else

end_at.description: The time at which the quiz submission will be overdue, and be flagged as a late submission.

CreatedEventData.description: The created event data object returns all the fields that were set in the format of the following example.  If a field does not exist it was not set. The value of each field changed is in the format of [:old_value, :new_value].  The created event type also includes a created_source field to specify what triggered the creation of the course.

created_source.description: The type of action that triggered the creation of the course.

id.description: The ID of the custom gradebook column

teacher_notes.description: When true, this column's visibility will be toggled in the Gradebook when a user selects to show or hide notes

hidden.description: won't be displayed if hidden is true

read_only.description: won't be editable in the gradebook UI

date.description: the date represented by this entry

graders.description: an array of the graders who were responsible for the submissions in this response. the submissions are grouped according to the person who graded them and the assignment they were submitted for.

id.description: The ID should match the Developer Key ID in canvas

is_lti_key.description: true the tool is a lti key, null is not a lti key

visible.description: Controls if the tool is visable

account_name.description: The name of the account associated with the tool

public_jwk.description: The public key in jwk format

vendor_code.description: The code of the vendor managing the tool

last_used_at.description: The date and time the tool was last used

access_token_count.description: The number of active access tokens associated with the tool

api_key.description: Api key for api access for the tool

notes.description: Notes for use specifications for the tool

name.description: Display name of the tool

user_id.description: ID of the user associated with the tool

created_at.description: The time the jwk was created

user_name.description: The user name of the tool creator

email.description: Email associated with the tool owner

require_scopes.description: True if the tool has required permissions, null if there are no needed permissions

icon_url.description: Icon to be displayed with the name of the tool

workflow_state.description: The current state of the tool

id.description: The ID of this topic.

message.description: The HTML content of the message body.

html_url.description: The URL to the discussion topic in canvas.

posted_at.description: The datetime the topic was posted. If it is null it hasn't been posted yet. (see delayed_post_at)

last_reply_at.description: The datetime for when the last reply was in the topic.

require_initial_post.description: If true then a user may not respond to other replies until that user has made an initial reply. Defaults to false.

user_can_see_posts.description: Whether or not posts in this topic are visible to the user.

discussion_subentry_count.description: The count of entries in the topic.

read_state.description: The read_state of the topic for the current user, 'read' or 'unread'.

unread_count.description: The count of unread entries of this topic for the current user.

subscribed.description: Whether or not the current user is subscribed to this topic.

subscription_hold.description: (Optional) Why the user cannot subscribe to this topic. Only one reason will be returned even if multiple apply. Can be one of: 'initial_post_required': The user must post a reply first; 'not_in_group_set': The user is not in the group set for this graded group discussion; 'not_in_group': The user is not in this topic's group; 'topic_is_announcement': This topic is an announcement

assignment_id.description: The unique identifier of the assignment if the topic is for grading, otherwise null.

delayed_post_at.description: The datetime to publish the topic (if not right away).

published.description: Whether this discussion topic is published (true) or draft state (false)

lock_at.description: The datetime to lock the topic (if ever).

locked.description: Whether or not the discussion is 'closed for comments'.

pinned.description: Whether or not the discussion has been 'pinned' by an instructor

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

lock_info.description: (Optional) Information for the user about the lock. Present when locked_for_user is true.

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This discussion is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

user_name.description: The username of the topic creator.

topic_children.description: DEPRECATED An array of topic_ids for the group discussions the user is a part of.

group_topic_children.description: An array of group discussions the user is a part of. Fields include: id, group_id

root_topic_id.description: If the topic is for grading and a group assignment this will point to the original topic in the course.

podcast_url.description: If the topic is a podcast topic this is the feed url for the current user.

discussion_type.description: The type of discussion. Values are 'side_comment', for discussions that only allow one level of nested comments, and 'threaded' for fully threaded discussions.

group_category_id.description: The unique identifier of the group category if the topic is a group discussion, otherwise null.

permissions.description: The current user's permissions on this topic.

allow_rating.description: Whether or not users can rate entries in this topic.

only_graders_can_rate.description: Whether or not grade permissions are required to rate entries.

sort_by_rating.description: Whether or not entries should be sorted by rating.

id.description: The ID of the enrollment.

course_id.description: The unique id of the course.

sis_course_id.description: The SIS Course ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

course_integration_id.description: The Course Integration ID in which the enrollment is associated. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

course_section_id.description: The unique id of the user's section.

section_integration_id.description: The Section Integration ID in which the enrollment is associated. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_account_id.description: The SIS Account ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_section_id.description: The SIS Section ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_user_id.description: The SIS User ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

enrollment_state.description: The state of the user's enrollment in the course.

limit_privileges_to_course_section.description: User can only access his or her own course section.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

root_account_id.description: The unique id of the user's account.

user_id.description: The unique id of the user.

associated_user_id.description: The unique id of the associated user. Will be null unless type is ObserverEnrollment.

role.description: The enrollment role, for course-level permissions. This field will match `type` if the enrollment role has not been customized.

role_id.description: The id of the enrollment role.

created_at.description: The created time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

updated_at.description: The updated time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

start_at.description: The start time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

end_at.description: The end time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

last_activity_at.description: The last activity time of the user for the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

last_attended_at.description: The last attended date of the user for the enrollment in a course, in ISO8601 format.

total_activity_time.description: The total activity time of the user for the enrollment, in seconds.

html_url.description: The URL to the Canvas web UI page for this course enrollment.

grades.description: The URL to the Canvas web UI page containing the grades associated with this enrollment.

override_grade.description: The user's override grade for the course.

override_score.description: The user's override score for the course.

unposted_current_grade.description: The user's current grade in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins.

unposted_final_grade.description: The user's final grade for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_current_score.description: The user's current score in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_final_score.description: The user's final score for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

has_grading_periods.description: optional: Indicates whether the course the enrollment belongs to has grading periods set up. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

totals_for_all_grading_periods_option.description: optional: Indicates whether the course the enrollment belongs to has the Display Totals for 'All Grading Periods' feature enabled. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_grading_period_title.description: optional: The name of the currently active grading period, if one exists. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_grading_period_id.description: optional: The id of the currently active grading period, if one exists. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_override_grade.description: The user's override grade for the current grading period.

current_period_override_score.description: The user's override score for the current grading period.

current_period_unposted_current_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permission to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_final_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, including muted/unposted assignments and including ungraded assignments with a score of 0. Only included if user has permission to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_current_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_unposted_current_score, if available. Only included if user has permission to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_final_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_unposted_final_score, if available. Only included if user has permission to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

id.description: The unique identifier for the enrollment term.

sis_term_id.description: The SIS id of the term. Only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: the unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

name.description: The name of the term.

start_at.description: The datetime of the start of the term.

end_at.description: The datetime of the end of the term.

workflow_state.description: The state of the term. Can be 'active' or 'deleted'.

overrides.description: Term date overrides for specific enrollment types

course_count.description: The number of courses in the term (available via include)

enrollment_terms.description: a paginated list of all terms in the account

id.description: The database ID of the ePortfolio

user_id.description: The user ID to which the ePortfolio belongs

name.description: The name of the ePortfolio

public.description: Whether or not the ePortfolio is visible without authentication

created_at.description: The creation timestamp for the ePortfolio

updated_at.description: The timestamp of the last time any of the ePortfolio attributes changed

workflow_state.description: The state of the ePortfolio. Either 'active' or 'deleted'

deleted_at.description: The timestamp when the ePortfolio was deleted, or else null

spam_status.description:
A flag indicating whether the ePortfolio has been
      flagged or moderated as spam. One of 'flagged_as_possible_spam',
      'marked_as_safe', 'marked_as_spam', or null

id.description: The database ID of the ePortfolio

eportfolio_id.description: The ePortfolio ID to which the entry belongs

position.description: The positional order of the entry in the list

name.description: The name of the ePortfolio

content.description: The user entered content of the entry

created_at.description: The creation timestamp for the ePortfolio

updated_at.description: The timestamp of the last time any of the ePortfolio attributes changed

id.description: the unique identifier for the export

created_at.description: the date and time this export was requested

attachment.description: attachment api object for the export ePub (not present until the export completes)

progress_url.description: The api endpoint for polling the current progress

user_id.description: The ID of the user who started the export

workflow_state.description: Current state of the ePub export: created exporting exported generating generated failed

ErrorReport.description: A collection of information around a specific notification of a problem

subject.description: The users problem summary, like an email subject line

comments.description: long form documentation of what was witnessed
comments.example: When I went to upload a .mov file to my files page, I got an error.  Retrying didn't help, other file types seem ok

user_perceived_severity.description: categorization of how bad the user thinks the problem is.  Should be one of [just_a_comment, not_urgent, workaround_possible, blocks_what_i_need_to_do, extreme_critical_emergency].

email.description: the email address of the reporting user

url.description: URL of the page on which the error was reported

context_asset_string.description: string describing the asset being interacted with at the time of error.  Formatted '[type]_[id]'

user_roles.description: comma seperated list of roles the reporting user holds.  Can be one [student], or many [teacher,admin]

ExceptionRecord.description: Lists associated courses that did not receive a change propagated from a blueprint

course_id.description: The ID of the associated course

conflicting_changes.description: A list of change classes in the associated course's copy of the item that prevented a blueprint change from being applied. One or more of ['content', 'points', 'due_dates', 'availability_dates'].

id.description: The ID of the feed

display_name.description: The title of the feed, pulled from the feed itself. If the feed hasn't yet been pulled, a temporary name will be synthesized based on the URL

url.description: The HTTP/HTTPS URL to the feed

header_match.description: If not null, only feed entries whose title contains this string will trigger new posts in Canvas

created_at.description: When this external feed was added to Canvas

verbosity.description: The verbosity setting determines how much of the feed's content is imported into Canvas as part of the posting. 'link_only' means that only the title and a link to the item. 'truncate' means that a summary of the first portion of the item body will be used. 'full' means that the full item body will be used.

url.description: URL to the external tool

new_tab.description: Whether or not there is a new tab for the external tool

context_id.description: The ID of the object the Favorite refers to

context_type.description: The type of the object the Favorite refers to (currently, only 'Course' is supported)

feature.description: The symbolic name of the feature, used in FeatureFlags

display_name.description: The user-visible name of the feature

applies_to.description:
The type of object the feature applies to (RootAccount, Account, Course, or User):
 * RootAccount features may only be controlled by flags on root accounts.
 * Account features may be controlled by flags on accounts and their parent accounts.
 * Course features may be controlled by flags on courses and their parent accounts.
 * User features may be controlled by flags on users and site admin only.

feature_flag.description: The FeatureFlag that applies to the caller

root_opt_in.description: If true, a feature that is 'allowed' globally will be 'off' by default in root accounts. Otherwise, root accounts inherit the global 'allowed' setting, which allows sub-accounts and courses to turn features on with no root account action.

beta.description: Whether the feature is a feature preview. If true, opting in includes ongoing updates outside the regular release schedule.

autoexpand.description: Whether the details of the feature are autoexpanded on page load vs. the user clicking to expand.

release_notes_url.description: A URL to the release notes describing the feature

context_type.description: The type of object to which this flag applies (Account, Course, or User). (This field is not present if this FeatureFlag represents the global Canvas default)

context_id.description: The id of the object to which this flag applies (This field is not present if this FeatureFlag represents the global Canvas default)

state.description: The policy for the feature at this context.  can be 'off', 'allowed', 'allowed_on', or 'on'.

locked.description: If set, this feature flag cannot be changed in the caller's context because the flag is set 'off' or 'on' in a higher context

FederatedAttributeConfig.description: A single attribute name to be federated when a user logs in

attribute.description: The name of the attribute as it will be sent from the authentication provider

provisioning_only.description: If the attribute should be applied only when provisioning a new user, rather than all logins

FederatedAttributesConfig.description: A mapping of Canvas attribute names to attribute names that a provider may send, in order to update the value of these attributes when a user logs in. The values can be a FederatedAttributeConfig, or a raw string corresponding to the "attribute" property of a FederatedAttributeConfig. In responses, full FederatedAttributeConfig objects are returned if JIT provisioning is enabled, otherwise just the attribute names are returned.

admin_roles.description: A comma separated list of role names to grant to the user. Note that these only apply at the root account level, and not sub-accounts. If the attribute is not marked for provisioning only, the user will also be removed from any other roles they currently hold that are not still specified by the IdP.

display_name.description: The full display name of the user

given_name.description: The first, or given, name of the user

integration_id.description: The secondary unique identifier for SIS purposes

name.description: The full name of the user

sortable_name.description: The full name of the user for sorting purposes

surname.description: The surname, or last name, of the user

media_entry_id.description: identifier for file in third-party transcoding service

lock_explanation.example: This assignment is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

preview_url.description: optional: url to the document preview. This url is specific to the user making the api call. Only included in submission endpoints.

for_submissions.description: If true, indicates this is a read-only folder containing files submitted to assignments

html_url.description: The URL to the Canvas web UI page for the user's grades, if this is a student enrollment.

current_grade.description: The user's current grade in the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade.

final_grade.description: The user's final grade for the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade.

current_score.description: The user's current score in the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this score.

final_score.description: The user's final score for the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this score.

current_points.description: The total points the user has earned in the class. Only included if user has permissions to view this score and 'current_points' is passed in the request's 'include' parameter.

unposted_current_grade.description: The user's current grade in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins.

unposted_final_grade.description: The user's final grade for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_current_score.description: The user's current score in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_final_score.description: The user's final score for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_current_points.description: The total points the user has earned in the class, including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score (typically teachers, TAs, and admins) and 'current_points' is passed in the request's 'include' parameter.

id.description: ID of the event.

created_at.description: timestamp of the event

excused_after.description: Boolean indicating whether the submission was excused after the change.

excused_before.description: Boolean indicating whether the submission was excused before the change.

graded_anonymously.description: Boolean indicating whether the student name was visible when the grade was given. Could be null if the grade change record was created before this feature existed.

version_number.description: Version Number of the grade change submission.

request_id.description: The unique request id of the request during the grade change.

assignment.description: ID of the assignment associated with the event

course.description: ID of the course associated with the event. will match the context_id in the associated assignment if the context type for the assignment is a course

student.description: ID of the student associated with the event. will match the user_id in the associated submission.

grader.description: ID of the grader associated with the event. will match the grader_id in the associated submission.

page_view.description: ID of the page view during the event if it exists.

id.description: the user_id of the user who graded the contained submissions

name.description: the name of the user who graded the contained submissions

assignments.description: the assignment groups for all submissions in this response that were graded by this user.  The details are not nested inside here, but the fact that an assignment is present here means that the grader did grade submissions for this assignment on the contextual date. You can use the id of a grader and of an assignment to make another API call to find all submissions for a grader/assignment combination on a given date.

id.description: The unique identifier for the grading period.

title.description: The title for the grading period.

start_date.description: The start date of the grading period.

end_date.description: The end date of the grading period.

close_date.description: Grades can only be changed before the close date of the grading period.

weight.description: A weight value that contributes to the overall weight of a grading period set which is used to calculate how much assignments in this period contribute to the total grade

is_closed.description: If true, the grading period's close_date has passed.

title.description: The title of the grading period set.

weighted.description: If true, the grading periods in the set are weighted.

display_totals_for_all_grading_periods.description: If true, the totals for all grading periods in the set are displayed.

drop_lowest.description: Number of lowest scores to be dropped for each user.

drop_highest.description: Number of highest scores to be dropped for each user.

never_drop.description: Assignment IDs that should never be dropped.

name.description: The name for an entry value within a GradingStandard that describes the range of the value

value.description: The value for the name of the entry within a GradingStandard.  The entry represents the lower bound of the range for the entry. This range includes the value up to the next entry in the GradingStandard, or 100 if there is no upper bound. The lowest value will have a lower bound range of 0.

title.description: the title of the grading standard

id.description: the id of the grading standard

context_type.description: the context this standard is associated with, either 'Account' or 'Course'

context_id.description: the id for the context either the Account or Course id

grading_scheme.description: A list of GradingSchemeEntry that make up the Grading Standard as an array of values with the scheme name and value

id.description: The ID of the group category.

name.description: The display name of the group category.

role.description: Certain types of group categories have special role designations. Currently, these include: 'communities', 'student_organized', and 'imported'. Regular course/account group categories have a role of null.

self_signup.description: If the group category allows users to join a group themselves, thought they may only be a member of one group per group category at a time. Values include 'restricted', 'enabled', and null 'enabled' allows students to assign themselves to a group 'restricted' restricts them to only joining a group in their section null disallows students from joining groups

auto_leader.description: Gives instructors the ability to automatically have group leaders assigned.  Values include 'random', 'first', and null; 'random' picks a student from the group at random as the leader, 'first' sets the first student to be assigned to the group as the leader

context_type.description: The course or account that the category group belongs to. The pattern here is that whatever the context_type is, there will be an _id field named after that type. So if instead context_type was 'Course', the course_id field would be replaced by an course_id field.

group_limit.description: If self-signup is enabled, group_limit can be set to cap the number of users in each group. If null, there is no limit.

sis_group_category_id.description: The SIS identifier for the group category. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage or view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

progress.description: If the group category has not yet finished a randomly student assignment request, a progress object will be attached, which will contain information related to the progress of the assignment request. Refer to the Progress API for more information

id.description: The ID of the group.

name.description: The display name of the group.

description.description: A description of the group. This is plain text.

is_public.description: Whether or not the group is public.  Currently only community groups can be made public.  Also, once a group has been set to public, it cannot be changed back to private.

followed_by_user.description: Whether or not the current user is following this group.

join_level.description: How people are allowed to join the group.  For all groups except for community groups, the user must share the group's parent course or account.  For student organized or community groups, where a user can be a member of as many or few as they want, the applicable levels are 'parent_context_auto_join', 'parent_context_request', and 'invitation_only'.  For class groups, where students are divided up and should only be part of one group of the category, this value will always be 'invitation_only', and is not relevant. * If 'parent_context_auto_join', anyone can join and will be automatically accepted. * If 'parent_context_request', anyone  can request to join, which must be approved by a group moderator. * If 'invitation_only', only those how have received an invitation my join the group, by accepting that invitation.

members_count.description: The number of members currently in the group

avatar_url.description: The url of the group's avatar

context_type.description: The course or account that the group belongs to. The pattern here is that whatever the context_type is, there will be an _id field named after that type. So if instead context_type was 'account', the course_id field would be replaced by an account_id field.

role.description: Certain types of groups have special role designations. Currently, these include: 'communities', 'student_organized', and 'imported'. Regular course/account groups have a role of null.

group_category_id.description: The ID of the group's category.

sis_group_id.description: The SIS ID of the group. Only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import if created through SIS. Only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

storage_quota_mb.description: the storage quota for the group, in megabytes

permissions.description: optional: the permissions the user has for the group. returned only for a single group and include[]=permissions

users.description: optional: A list of users that are members in the group. Returned only if include[]=users. WARNING: this collection's size is capped (if there are an extremely large number of users in the group (thousands) not all of them will be returned).  If you need to capture all the users in a group with certainty consider using the paginated /api/v1/groups/<group_id>/memberships endpoint.

id.description: The id of the membership object

group_id.description: The id of the group object to which the membership belongs

user_id.description: The id of the user object to which the membership belongs

workflow_state.description: The current state of the membership. Current possible values are 'accepted', 'invited', and 'requested'

moderator.description: Whether or not the user is a moderator of the group (the must also be an active member of the group to moderate)

just_created.description: optional: whether or not the record was just created on a create call (POST), i.e. was the user just added to the group, or was the user already a member

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import if created through SIS. Only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

id.description: The ID of the help link

text.description: The name of the help link

subtext.description: The description of the help link
